1.17.1.name: Note Vortex
1.17.1.description:
It's back and it's not broken this time!

Ever wanted notes bigger than the sun? No? Well here you go anyway!

A very simple mod that has options for:
     - world rotation that rotates your world by 1 degree every time a note spawns (Credit to Phish, his guide is lower down)
     - A fun note effect that causes notes to spawn beneath you and swirl upwards.
     - A multiplier for your note size, allowing you to make the notes bigger than the sun or smaller than your brain!

1.17.1.name: Discord Presence
1.17.1.description:
Allows discord rich presence to see which song you're playing, the current time, and much more.

Mod Installation: https://github.com/Lauriethefish/Quest-Discord-Presence-Client/blob/main/README.md
You must follow this to set up the client on your PC and the mod on your Quest.
If you get a virus warning during installation, ignore it, this isn't a virus - Windows is oversensitive.

Alternatively, follow this guide to use MadMagic's app for general presence of any Quest app: https://github.com/madmagic007/Oculus-Quest-Presence

If it's not working, try these:
- Make sure your Quest IP hasn't changed, if so, update it in the app, see installation.
- Make sure you've opened the app.
- Make sure Beat Saber is open and your headset is on your head.
- You have discord on your PC not in the browser.
- Try restarting discord.

1.17.1.description:
This mod allows you to change the spawn offset of any map at will to a desired jump distance. Features also include setting the jump distance to the map's default or to a configurable reaction time.

This is a port of the PC mod with the same name, created by Zephyr: https://discord.com/channels/441805394323439646/889894313763422218/895936512938623056
If you find any bugs, please let me know.

1.16.4.name: Particles
1.16.4.description:
Quest Particles allows you to boost/reduce/remove note slash particles, saber clash particles, remove environmental dust, and make particle rainbow.

This mod does nothing out of the box. You will need to use the in-game mod config UI (Settings -> Mod Settings -> ParticleTuner) to change the particle behaviors.

Known Issues:
* Particles having white tints in rainbow mode (colorOverLifetime?)
* Sometimes the preset buttons may fail to work (please lmk if you can reproduce this issue consistently)

1.13.2.name: CrashMod
1.13.2.description: Crash your mod via various triggers. e. g. Crash on Play, Miss, Good cut, Turn and way more

1.13.2.name: Clock Mod
1.13.2.description: Displays the time in game. Alternatively also the Battery Percentage

1.13.2.name: Clock Mod
1.13.2.description:
Features:
- Toggle Clock off in maps.
- Change Clock between 24/12 Hour format.
- Toggle Seconds on/off
- Added HoverText explanations to the config menu.

Missing Features:
- Change size
- Change color

Note:
Since the original source code only had the code to show the clock, I had to rewrite things like changing the format to 12 from 24 hours and toggling seconds on and off.
Which means any previous config values will not load. You will have to set the settings again.

1.13.2.name: Third Person Mod
1.13.2.description: View yourself in 3rd person while playing. Features include a spinning camera, flying through the whole beat saber environment and way more

1.13.2.name: Qounters-
1.13.2.description: Store brand version of Counters+ for the Quest version of Beat Saber. Adds a variety of configurable Qounters to display statistics in-game.

1.13.2.name: Third Person mod
1.13.2.description:
A mod which lets you play in third person

Features:
- Play with a fixed camera position
- Fly anywhere
- Fix the camera to your saber
- And more options to keep you away from motion sickness

1.13.2.name: ModList
1.13.2.description:
Allows you to see which mods have loaded correctly ingame, and tells you why a mod failed to load. Useful for support and troubleshooting.

To view loaded mods, go to the settings icon in the main menu, then select mod settings and go to mod list.

1.13.2.name: Particles
1.13.2.description:
Quest Particles allows you to boost/reduce/remove note slash particles, saber clash particles, remove environmental dust, and make particle rainbow.

This mod does nothing out of the box. You will need to use the in-game mod config UI (Settings -> Mod Settings -> ParticleTuner) to change the particle behaviors.

Known Issues:
* Particles having white tints in rainbow mode (colorOverLifetime?)
* Sometimes the preset buttons may fail to work (please lmk if you can reproduce this issue consistently)

1.13.2.name: Custom Backgrounds
1.13.2.description:
Import your own 360 images as custom skyboxes!
Scans the 'CustomBackgrounds' ModData folder for imported images.

1.13.2.name: Custom Fail Text
1.13.2.description:
Allows you to customise the text that appears when you fail a level.
The text can be changed in the mod settings menu.

1.13.2.name: DebrisTweaks
1.13.2.description: Allows for full customization of various note debris parameters, including scale, lifetime and velocity.

1.13.2.name: Discord Presence
1.13.2.description:
Allows discord rich presence to see which song you're playing, the current time, and much more.

Mod Installation: https://github.com/Lauriethefish/Quest-Discord-Presence-Client/blob/main/README.md
You must follow this to set up the client on your PC and the mod on your Quest.
If you get a virus warning during installation, ignore it, this isn't a virus - Windows is oversensitive.

Alternatively, follow this guide to use MadMagic's app for general presence of any Quest app: https://github.com/madmagic007/Oculus-Quest-Presence

If it's not working, try these:
- Make sure your Quest IP hasn't changed, if so, update it in the app, see installation.
- Make sure you've opened the app.
- Make sure Beat Saber is open and your headset is on your head.
- You have discord on your PC not in the browser.
- Try restarting discord.

1.13.2.name: PauseConfirm
1.13.2.description:
Makes you confirm before going back to the menu, restarting or pressing continue when in the pause menu. This is to avoid you accidentally doing it when you're about to set a really good play, which I'm sure you've all done many times.

To choose which buttons require confirmation go to the Settings Icon in the main menu -> Mod Settings -> PauseConfirm. The default is that all three buttons require confirmation, but some might not want that.

1.13.2.name: QuestSounds
1.13.2.description:
QuestSounds or QSounds for short, allows the user to change sounds without asset mods, 
just drop them into default path or your custom path!

Features:
  Support for OGG, MP3 and WAV file formats!
  Creates QuestSounds folder at /sdcard/ModData/com.beatgames.beatsaber/Mods/
  AFTER YOU HAVE RAN THE MOD ONCE
  Config for disabling and enabling Custom Sounds!
  Custom filepaths in config, so you can decide where you want the sounds!

Planned features:
- Settings Menu to select Sounds.
- More Sounds to customize

1.13.2.name: BeatTogether
1.13.2.description: A multiplayer private server for the modding community. Supports crossplay between PC and Quest.

1.13.2.description: Custom color for your energy bar which changes according to your health and Rainbow mode

1.13.2.description: Customize all arrow directions on a beatmap

1.13.2.name: AntiVertigo
1.13.2.description: Spawns a plane or circle under you to help you deal with vertigo issues.

1.13.2.name: Custom Pillows Quest
1.13.2.description:
This mod is a spiritual port of the mod for PC of the same name by Toni Macaroni!
These pillows can be anything you want them to be, as long as you can put it on a flat texture. This mod was Commissioned by @TKC 

 - Pillows Take their texture from a pool of active textures, enabled in the mod settings and listed from sdcard/ModData/com.beatgames.beatsaber/Mods/CustomPillowsQuest/images
 - Pillows spawn using a constellation, configured in the mod settings and located at sdcard/ModData/com.beatgames.beatsaber/Mods/CustomPillowsQuest/constellations
 - The mod can be disabled in the menu
 - Features a shuffle button in the menu for shuffling the current iteration of textures

Extra Pillow Textures:
https://github.com/RedBrumbler/CustomPillowsQuest/releases/latest/download/ExtraPillows.zip

1.13.2.name: Qosmetics
1.13.2.description: Quest Cosmetics on a whole new level!

1.13.2.name: PinkCore
1.13.2.description: PinkCore, formerly known as PinkUtils is a core mod that ports over many required features which ensures a smooth PC-Like experience.

1.13.0.name: Darth Maul
1.13.0.description:
A long awated rewrite of the original Darth Maul mod by Henwill8, which was originally created by riku1227!
This also contains many config options and is initially toggleable via the in-game modifiers.

1.13.0.name: ModList
1.13.0.description:
Allows you to see which mods have loaded correctly ingame, and tells you why a mod failed to load. Useful for support and troubleshooting.

To view loaded mods, go to the settings icon in the main menu, then select mod settings and go to mod list.

1.13.0.name: Custom Fail Text
1.13.0.description:
Allows you to customise the text that appears when you fail a level.
The text can be changed in the mod settings menu.

1.13.0.name: DebrisTweaks
1.13.0.description: Allows for full customization of various note debris parameters, including scale, lifetime and velocity.

1.13.0.name: Discord Presence
1.13.0.description:
Allows discord rich presence to see which song you're playing, the current time, and much more.

Mod Installation: https://github.com/Lauriethefish/Quest-Discord-Presence-Client/blob/main/README.md
You must follow this to set up the client on your PC and the mod on your Quest.
If you get a virus warning during installation, ignore it, this isn't a virus - Windows is oversensitive.

Alternatively, follow this guide to use MadMagic's app for general presence of any Quest app: https://github.com/madmagic007/Oculus-Quest-Presence

If it's not working, try these:
- Make sure your Quest IP hasn't changed, if so, update it in the app, see installation.
- Make sure you've opened the app.
- Make sure Beat Saber is open and your headset is on your head.
- You have discord on your PC not in the browser.
- Try restarting discord.

1.13.0.name: BeatTogether
1.13.0.description: A multiplayer private server for the modding community. Supports crossplay between PC and Quest.

1.13.0.name: Quest Particles
1.13.0.description: Partially ported ParticleOverdrive to the Quest. Particles (a.k.a. ParticleTuner) allows you to adjust the particles spawned after slicing a note, remove saber clashing effects, and reduce environmental dust. There's also a built-in rainbow mode for particles :)

1.13.0.name: RedBar
1.13.0.description: Custom color for your energy bar which changes according to your health and Rainbow mode

1.13.0.name: PinkCore
1.13.0.description: PinkCore, formerly known as PinkUtils is a core mod that ports over many required features which ensures a smooth PC-Like experience.
